intro: Krascheninnikovia fruticulosa, commonly known as the desert lichen or stonecrop, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Eurasia. It is a low-growing perennial that forms dense mats, often covering rocky or sandy soils. The plant has small, fleshy leaves and produces clusters of yellow or white flowers. It is well adapted to harsh environments, with mechanisms to conserve water and withstand extreme temperatures. Its unique structure and resilience make it an important component of desert ecosystems.
